RunIdentifier.description: Used to store information about run (e.g., runId).

runId.description: The globally unique ID of the run.

JobIdentifier.description: Used to store information about job (e.g., namespace and name).

name.description: The unique name of a job within that namespace

RootIdentifier.description: Used to store information about root job and root run.

JobDependencyType.description: Used to describe whether the upstream job directly triggers the downstream job, or whether the dependency is implicit (e.g. time-based).

JobDependencySequenceTriggerRule.description: Used to describe the exact sequence condition on which the downstream job can be executed (FINISH_TO_START - downstream job can start when upstream finished; FINISH_TO_FINISH - job executions can overlap, but need to finish in specified order; START_TO_START - jobs need to start at the same time in parallel).

JobDependencyStatusTriggerRule.description: Used to describe if the downstream job should be run based on the status of the upstream job.

JobDependency.description: Used to store all information about job dependency (e.g., job, run, root etc.).

JobDependenciesRunFacet.description: Job dependencies facet maps execution depencencies (control flow relationships) between upstream and downstream job runs

upstream.description: Job runs that must complete before the current run can start.

downstream.description: Job runs that are waiting for the successful completion of the current run.

trigger_rule.description: Specifies the condition under which this job will run based on the status of upstream jobs, for example: ALL_SUCCESS|ALL_DONE|ONE_SUCCESS|NONE_FAILED.
